author: Jonathan W.
title: Smart Contract-Based Paper Wallets
description: Paper wallets are essential for growing Cardano, but security at point-of-sale is lacking.

assessments.note: The idea is interesting in the sense of improving a situation that already exists. Paper wallets are, in fact, an important variable for Cardano's growth, and if the issue of security could be improved it would certainly benefit the community. I'm just not sure if this security system would be developed by an application, but probably yes, in that case it would really be a very valuable application for the community.
This would be a great addition to the ecosystem. Simple safe cold storage options are valuable.

Seems like a well thought out proposal which increases the usefulness of paper wallets. I'm not super familiar with how much usage paper wallets receive but I think the ecosystem will benefit from this.
The proposal appears to be a suitable use case of challenge funds although I note lack of comments from the community.

It is a brilliant idea to cater the problem of the paper wallet users; security.

The idea is by having a third party (mobile apps) to validate the paper wallet.

It is an easy project with a big impact on the community.

Making the ability to purchase ADA easier and more reliable to people who may not have an exchange account, or no desire to create one, would almost certainly lead to a wider adoption of the Cardano ecosystem and would drive user adoption.

The author of the proposal claims to be a veteran of the security technology he intends to implement (Plutus smart), in addition to having experience with Cryto and development technology. He attaches his linkedin profile to prove his achievements, which always transmits security in the past information. I just missed the intention of forming a team, because hardly a project can happen entirely under the responsibility of one person. As far as I can imagine, at least it would be interesting to include a UX / UI designer to make the application more ergonomic for the public. Therefore, I believe that the author does have competence, but he also needs other people to carry out a more solid project.

Developer seems to be on the right track in terms of accomplishing this. Being a plutus pioneer is great, hopefully he will ask questions to others there on how to accomplish the details of this task. The task is narrow enough in scope that I think this will be accomplished successfully.

Difficult to gauge the experience and skillset of the author without further information. This proposal would have certainly benefitted by having a github link to show work completed to date. The budget is not excessive and if the use case can be validated, I think this is an interesting proposal.
From the information given, the scope of competence and related experience is not well detailed. there is no evidence that there is capacity to deliver this project

Yes. The timeline for the project spelled out in a general terms. However it is a straightforward project development.

Once product is ready, the biggest implementation is to commercialised it. Proposer mentioned that he will request another round of funding to cater this implementation nation/world wide.

The scope of this proposal is developing a prototype for the paper wallets authentification system, given the fact that the proposal states that he's a Plutus Pioneer and the timeframes given, no major obstacles in developing this prototype should occur. The only slight reservations I have about the project is the fact that it's completely reliant on the existence of smart contracts and the timeframes given for the project don't take any possible delays with the deployment of that into account. I would have liked to see a clear identification of this risk and others that the team might face in the implementation of the project.

The author provides a plan of goals to be achieved according to the months and a division of the financial amount that has been requested. It also clarifies what your intentions are in case the plan works, how to expand the project. Apparently, an investment would no longer be necessary, since the application would be ready, it would only be distributed among more stores. Thus, the details of the practical part of the plan are well understood. Just one observation would be that, as I said earlier, I believe that other people would also be needed to carry out the project, the money would need to be reorganized between the parties, including the salaries of the new team members. Other than that, everything seems to me well resolved.
This is a relatively simple plan which will add to the ecosystem and the proposer should be able to deliver.
There are measures for success detailed here which are great. I think they are reasonable and the budget breakdown also makes sense. No concerns at this time.

The proposal is lacking sufficient information to really help it stand out. Most things considered by the author seem reasonable but there is little further information to work with in assessing success of the proposal. It strikes me as the sort of proposal that needed to have already had the wheels set in motion prior to application for funds.
Yes, problem statement is clear, methodology and project timeline forecast is clear. It is easy to audit the  project later. Project scope is not too big.

The development of the prototype, and progress made towards that goal would be verifiable tasks and as such would be the relatively easy to audit by the community. The timeframes and metrics are described clearly and would be easy to follow, the budget is a bit low, but could be sufficient depending on the location of the development team.

solution: Smart Paper Wallets linked to a Plutus smart contract which requires merchant validation.
